intro: Heracleum algeriense, commonly known as Algerian cowparade, is a tall herbaceous plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features large, compound leaves that are typically fern-like in appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Heracleum algeriense is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can grow up to several meters in height.
